RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIL BOUGIE dueled for the early lead and drew clear past the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily encouraged through the stretch. SMOKIN LADY gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, rallied for second inside the sixteenth pole and finished well. SWISS HORIZON steadied at the start then moved to the outside to give chase, rounded the turn in the four path and finished evenly to take third later yards. VIESTE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, steadied in tight approaching the eighth pole but finished evenly. PLAYING FOR TWO chased through the backstretch and raced in range in the three path on the turn, then weakened toward mid-stretch. BOWMANS LAZY GIRL engaged in close early chase but faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Swiss Horizon
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied start,chased outside,4p turn,even finish,up 3rd late yds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 15800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JANUARY 27, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since January 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Races Where E ntered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEY CONGRATS dueled for the lead and showed the way from the three eighths pole, was met at even terms at the rail midway on the turn, dueled clear toward mid-stretch and held on well. KUKULKAN gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn in the four and five paths, dug in from the head of the lane to take second in the final yards and just lasted. PROTA was shuffled back on the chute then gave chase outside, rounded the turn in the five and six paths, finished well and just missed second. LOADED SNIPER had the early lead then dueled from the three eighths pole, reached even terms two deep midway on the turn but dropped back mid-stretch and flattened stride later yards. PAPA TONY steadied at the start then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. GRAND FIBER gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. STRETCH THE TRUTH gave chase inside then faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Hey Congrats
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled,up 3/8,even terms rail turn,clear 1/16,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Kukulkan
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4& 5p turn,dug in lane,up 2nd late,just lasted

ENTRY.NAME: Loaded Sniper
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and C and B Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead,chased from 3/8,even terms mid turn,flatten later yrds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 19600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHUTUPN'KISSME took the lead on the chute and rated clear inside, came under pressure at the quarter pole, rounded the turn near the rail and was steadily handled in the lane. RIVER REWARDS RVF gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, dug in through the lane and just held on for second. RUNNING FREE gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted leaving the turn but came back to finish well and just missed second. NAUGHTY NAN chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. EMBERLY gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn, left the turn outside and showed little in the lane. SISTER JOANN chased inside, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. CEDAR'S WISH became anxious in the gate then hesitated and came away rank which caused the rider to lose his irons.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRYDA took the lead approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was kept on the bit through the lane. MACKENZIE'S MUSIC gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dueled through the stretch for second. SENTELLA was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the six path and got up for third the final strides. SNOWY JUBA CAT was brushed leaving the gate, picked up the chase and raced off the rail on the turn, then flattened later yards. AIM'S JUBILEE gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened in the lane. JACKS SISTER JILL bobbled and made contact with Sentella leaving the gate, picked up the chase past the chute, rounded the turn in the five path and ran evenly in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Stryda
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 7/16,rated pace,rail turn,kept on bit lane

ENTRY.NAME: Snowy Juba Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed break,chased,off rail turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Allowance Purse 20700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JULY 27, 2021. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FEARNOUGHT took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over RIDICULOUS, who rate close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and dug in gamely to the wire. HAGLER raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and finished well. SARGENT KOBE raced off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, came through the far turn in the five path and weakened. YABBA DABBA DUDE raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but showed little response. TEXTPECTATION was not a factor. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Ridiculous
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,game try lane

ENTRY.NAME: Fearnought
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,determinedly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANNY'S WINKSTER rated close off the rail, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, dug in through the final furlong and took the nod under the wire. MIMS SECOND CHANCE raced with the pace while alternating the lead with FLASH OF DAY, dueled from the three eighths pole and contested even terms two deep on the far turn, cleared that one inside the sixteenth pole but missed the nod under the wire. The latter raced with the pace inside while alternating the lead with Mims Second Chance, dueled that one leaving the three eighths pole and contested even terms nearest the rail on the far turn, but flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and ran evenly in the lane. A THOUSAND IDOLS rated close in the three path on the opening turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole but flattened stride off the rail on the far turn. STRONG CURLIN dropped well back early on. This race was hand timed. Morning Artie ran loose in the post parade and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Danny's Winkster
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid 3/8,3p far turn,dug in lane,nod final jump

ENTRY.NAME: A Thousand Idols
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close 3p,chased past 7/16,flattened off rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Mims Second Chance
ENTRY.COMMENT: w/pace,dueled from 3/8,even terms 2d turn,missed nod wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S HAT TRICK was shut off at the break then rated close inside, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in for the lead nearing mid-stretch, drew briefly clear and held on. REMYS SHOWTIME veered out leaving the gate then took the lead inside approaching the first turn and rated the pace, dug in to the challenge of Epic Time leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the advantage at the rail on the far turn, was met toward mid-stretch but held well for second. MINISTRY OF MAGIC saved early ground then bid leaving the three eighths pole, circled five wide on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for third. BOSS E BOOGS raced three wide on the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, came through the far turn three wide and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. CHANGE YOUR LUCK rounded the opening turn about the four path, ran outside into the backstretch and gave chase past the three eighths pole, raced in the six path on the far turn and passed rivals widest. PENGUIN PARADE exchanged contact with MYSTIC O'SHAUNESIE leaving the gate then raced two deep while between horses on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and flattened in the lane. The latter exchanged contact with Penguin Parade leaving the gate and rounded the opening turn about the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and weakened in the lane. EPIC TIME raced with the early pace two deep, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back toward the five sixteenths and weakened off the rail on the far turn. This race was hand timed.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLISS THIS rated close off the rail on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, took over two deep midway on the far turn and held on under steady stretch handling. MISS YOU AJAX stumbled leaving the gate and raced in the five path the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, improved in the four path on the far turn and dug in to take second later yards while gaining marginally on the winner. VOICE OF NOW took the lead past the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and relented toward mid-stretch. MUD BUG ducked out and hit the gate at the break then saved ground, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. SEAN THE HAMMER stalked from the three path on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded in the four path on the far turn. COUNTRY CHARLIE rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase past the half mile pole but flattened in the four path on the far turn. ANVIL saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. BOSEY saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. CINCO LINKO rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded through the backstretch. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Bliss This
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,bid 7/16,up 2d mid turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Voice of Now
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured past 3/8,met mid turn,relented 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Mud Bug
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Miss You Ajax
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,5p 1st turn,bid 7/16,4p far turn,up 2nd later yrds
